Komisi Yudisial Seleksi 13 Calon Hakim Agung
06 Nov 2019, 02:03 by ANTARA, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi hakim. (Istockphoto/Wavebreakmedia)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Komisi Yudisial (KY) menyampaikan saat ini ada 13 orang calonÂ hakim agung yang melaju ke tahap wawancara pada pekan depan. Sebanyak 12 orang di antaranya berasal dari jalur karier, sedangkan satu orang lainnya dari nonkarier.Pada Juli lalu KY pernah menyatakan ada 70 calon hakim agung yang telah lolos seleksi CHA 2019, jumlah itu menyusut dari total 80 orang pendaftar. Sebanyak 44 orang dari calon hakim itu disebut berasal dari jalur karier sedangkan 26 orang lainnya nonkarier.Ketua Bidang Rekrutmen Hakim KY Aidul Fitriciada Azhari menjelaskan pihaknya tidak memiliki preferensi asal calon hakim agung dari jalur karier atau nonkarier. Sebanyak 13 calon hakim agung disebut berdasarkan tes objektif dan hasilnya bisa berubah setiap tahun.Aidul mengatakan pada tahun ini pihaknya sudah menyusun kompetensi secara swakelola dan telah melakukan uji validasi. Menurut dia ada perubahan pada uji validasi dalam seleksi calon hakim agung yang kini lebih menekankan pada kemampuan dan kompetensi."Uji validasi mungkin ada yang berubah, kami menekankan kemampuan atau kompetensi sebagai hakim agung, bukan hakim pertama dan banding yang memeriksa fakta. Hakim agung terkait dengan penerapan hukum," ujar Aidul di Gedung KY pada Selasa (5/11), seperti dilansir dari Antara.Total ada 12 kompetensi yang diuji. Selain terkait kompetensi teknis, aspek kepribadian seperti integritas serta wawasan global, kebangsaan, dan kenegaraan juga turut diuji.Daftar 13 calon hakim agung:Kamar Agama1. Judicial Commission Selection 13 Candidates for Supreme Court Justices
06 Nov 2019, 02:03 by ANTARA, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of judge. (Istockphoto / Wavebreakmedia)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Judicial Commission (KY) said that there are currently 13 prospective judges who will go to the interview stage next week. As many as 12 of them came from career paths, while one other person was non-career. In July KY had stated that there were 70 candidates for Supreme Court Justices who had passed the 2019 CHA selection, the number had shrunk from a total of 80 registrants. As many as 44 people from the prospective judge were said to come from career paths while 26 others were non-career. The Chief of Judicial Recruitment for Judge KY Aidul Fitriciada Azhari explained that his party had no preference as to the prospective Chief Justice from the career path or non-career. A total of 13 candidates for Supreme Court justices are referred to based on objective tests and the results can change every year. Alul said this year he had arranged competencies in a self-managed manner and had conducted a validation test. According to him there was a change in the validation test in the selection of prospective justices who now put more emphasis on ability and competence. "The validation test may have changed, we emphasized the ability or competence as the justices, not the first and appealed judges who examined the facts. with the application of the law, "Aidul said in the KY Building on Tuesday (11/5), as reported by Antara. In total there were 12 competencies tested. Besides related to technical competence, aspects of personality such as integrity and global insight, nationality, and statehood were also examined.
